intro: Erigeron amplexicaulis, commonly known as the clasping blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, blue-green leaves that clasp the stem, giving it its common name. It produces showy blue to purple ray flowers surrounded by yellow disk flowers, which attract pollinators. Erigeron amplexicaulis thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands.
